learning_outcomes.description: Understand and reflect critically on how Phenomenology and Existentialism are related, and what distinguishes them from other approaches to philosophy in the nineteenth, twentieth and twenty-first centuries;
Understand and analyse arguments, concepts and problems in Phenomenology and Existentialism;
Understand better the complex nature of philosophical texts in the tradition of Phenomenology and Existentialism;
Demonstrate reasoned thought, creativity, and a high quality of written expression; and
Examine, discuss and debate the main issues regarding the relevance of Phenomenology and Existentialism to our contemporary context.

assessments.due_date: There will be two short written in-class pieces in weeks 6 and 8.
assessments.task_description:
Tutorials commence in the second week of semester and are assessed based on contributions as attendance alone cannot be assessed. Tutorials run from weeks 2-12 (week 3 there will be no tutorials due to the public holiday that week). The mark will be based on regular participation and two short written submissions.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The written pieces will be submitted in tutorials.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: If you are unable to attend either tutorial in weeks 6 or 8 to complete the written pieces due to illness or other issues (documentation required) you can arrange with me to complete them in my office.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Choose a question from a set provided that is related to the course material from weeks 2-9 and write a 1700 (1600-1800) word essay. This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Write a 1300 (1200-1400) word essay on a question based on weeks 10-12 of the course.  This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial Participation

Constructive discussion in the tutorial and two in-class short written pieces in weeks 6 and 8. Tutorials will be held in weeks 2-12 (week 3 is missing due to the public holiday).
